title: Looking for an Irish/Gaelic typeface
content: I'm doing something for a traditional Irish band, so I'm looking for some sort of a gaelic looking typeface to set headlines in. Does anyone know of any thing that might work? Extra points if it's an Uncial face.
author: takach

comments.content:
<cite>Extra points if it’s an Uncial face</cite>

This one comes as both an uppercase-lowercase and an alternative uppercase-middlecase (=uncial) font:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130113035146im_/http:/typophile.com/files/andron_irish_4691.jpg)

Andreas, what is the typeface?

Baile Atha Cliath = Dublin :), missing the accent over the A, Baile Átha Cliath

Dan has a good writeup here as well

Gaelic and/or Uncial Fonts  
 [http://www.typeoff.de/?p=107](http://web.archive.org/web/20130113035146/http:/www.typeoff.de/?p=107 "http://www.typeoff.de/?p=107")

<cite>what is the typeface?</cite>

You may wonder or not, it’s – Andron.  
Sorry for the missing accent. The fonts do have accented letters, of course.  
The image is from a type specimen I did a few years ago.

Ciarán Ó Duibhín has a fairly complete survey of what's currently available here:  
 [http://www.smo.uhi.ac.uk/~oduibhin/mearchlar/fonts.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20130113035146/http:/www.smo.uhi.ac.uk/~oduibhin/mearchlar/fonts.htm "http://www.smo.uhi.ac.uk/~oduibhin/mearchlar/fonts.htm")

Do you want to translate key animation names to english by saying that akira1975 will do?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130113035146im_/http:/typophile.com/files/key_animators_5081.png)

Quanta Uncial is a more contemporary design. Has some Gaelic characteristics in the alternates (lower-case provides alternate chars)  
The Uncial has never been fully developed due to lack of time and uncertainty of market...

See [http://alphabets.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130113035146/http:/alphabets.com/ "http://alphabets.com/")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130113035146im_/http:/typophile.com/files/peterAlphabetFonts-6_5476.gif)

If you're interested, I could set a few words for you.

P

[http://slowprint.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130113035146/http:/slowprint.com/ "http://slowprint.com/") Letterpress for Typographers!  
 [http://alphabets.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130113035146/http:/alphabets.com/ "http://alphabets.com/")

Seo Tae,  
please stop posting your translation requests. This thread is about Iris/Gaelic typefaces. This forum is about type and typography.  
As [Ken Lunde said](http://web.archive.org/web/20130113035146/http:/typophile.com/node/61919#comment-393201), “there is a massive difference between 1) asking someone, or a group, to translate and/or transliterate text from one language to another as a one-time or one-off request, and 2) doing what you're doing, which clearly amounts to significant work or effort, and is thus extraordinarily unreasonable and incredibly inappropriate.”  
Further attempts, here, in the [other thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20130113035146/http:/typophile.com/node/61919) or anywhere else will be treated as spam, and deleted.  
Thank you,  
F
